info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 16 at 6:22PM EDT until July 16 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL FAUQUIER AND CENTRAL CULPEPER COUNTIES... At 622 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bealeton, or 10 miles east of Culpeper, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Bealeton, Opal, Remington, Midland, Elkwood, Stevensburg, Brandy Station, Lois, Morrisville, Goldvein and Sumerduck. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
